snippet: The recent sales of The Boston Globe and The Washington Post make The New York Times the nation’s last major newspaper run by a family.
abstract: New York Times publisher Arthur Sulzberger Jr emphatically declares that The Times is not for sale, responding to speculation after a week in which both The Boston Globe and The Washington Post were purchased by new owners; asserts that the newspaper is well positioned to continue growth, citing digital subscription model, profitability and strong cash flow.
lead_paragraph: The recent sales of The Boston Globe and The Washington Post make The New York Times the nation’s last major newspaper run by a family.

headline.main: The Times Isn’t for Sale, Its Publisher Declares
headline.print_headline: The Times Isn’t for Sale, Its Publisher Declares
